intro: Limodorum concolor, commonly known as the white hellebore, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and toxicity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
